key_points: CNN fired anchor Chris Cuomo for aiding his brother, former NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo, amid sexual harassment allegations.
The firing followed a suspension and investigation into Cuomo's involvement in his brother's defense strategies.
CNN hired an unidentified law firm to review Chris Cuomo's conduct, which recommended his termination.
CNN chief Jeff Zucker informed Chris Cuomo of the decision and stressed the complexity of such decisions in an email to staff.
Chris Cuomo expressed disappointment in a Twitter statement but was proud of his team's work.
The investigation into Cuomo's conduct will continue 'as appropriate' according to CNN.
Chris Cuomo had previously sought information on accusers and assisted in crafting responses to allegations.
CNN had been under scrutiny for months over Chris Cuomo's conduct even before his firing.
The firing leaves a notable gap in CNN's prime-time lineup.
Allegations resurfaced of Chris Cuomo groping a female colleague 16 years ago, to which he has previously apologized.
